snippet: Libya has asked the International Criminal Court in The Hague to withdraw its claims to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and Libya’s former intelligence chief so that they can be tried in Tripoli.
abstract: Libya asks the International Criminal Court in The Hague to withdraw its claims to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and Libya’s former intelligence chief, Abdulla al-Senussi, so that they can be tried in Tripoli.
lead_paragraph: Libya has asked the International Criminal Court in The Hague to withdraw its claims to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and Libya’s former intelligence chief so that they can be tried in Tripoli.

headline.seo: Libya Asks Hague Court to Stand Down
headline.main: Libya: Hague Court Is Asked to Stand Down
